results.title: Silent voices
results.brief_description: Broken into three segments entitled ‘The Rape’, ‘The Miscarriage’ and ‘The Dream’, this expressionist animation poignantly conveys the emotional trauma experienced by a young woman who is sexually abused by her tyrannical father. A more fully realised version of ‘deCollage’ a shorter film by the same director

results.title: Astrozoology 101
results.brief_description: An animation using the cutout techniques pioneered by Lotte Reiniger that revises the fairytale ‘The Frog Prince’. In this version the princess is a devouring alien.

results.title: RMIT AIM Collection 1992
results.brief_description:
Compilation of student work from the University of RMIT Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) Department. 1992.
The Centre for Animation and Interactive Media, its courses, facilities, staff and collection of work was transferred from Swinburne University of Technology to RMIT University in 1995.

results.title: Yum yum noodles
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, Troy Innocent, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Time for a bowl of something hot, wet and instant - Yum Yum noodles. Buy some today! MSG added for good tasty flavour. A parody of a noodle advertisment that comments on stereotypes of Asian cultures.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Jem Cohen: early works
results.brief_description: A rich and haunting collection of early works from an artist who paints with fragments of image and sound from New York street life. Dogs, passing cars, the homeless, drugged and alienated people drift through these works, in the rhythms of their own time. Simple mysteries are uncovered through a window, in half deserted streets, and in wind blown garbage. Voices become confessions, shadows become cinematic and we are absorbed and compiled into a world of wonder, in which people inevitably leave traces - and lists.

group_works.title: This is a history of New York

results.title: This is a history of New York
results.brief_description: ‘This is a History of New York’ chronicles the seven ages of mankind from Prehistory to the Space Age. In the Age of Hunters and Gatherers, stray dogs patrol the streets while the homeless forage for food. Later in the Medieval Period, crazed street preachers pace frantically before ominous gothic architecture. The richness of Cohen’s vision is found in this haunting imagery and the perception that the thriving city of New York is really the accumulation of humanity’s failures, as well as triumphs.

group_siblings.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
group_siblings.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio

results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: Drink Deep
results.brief_description: Drink Deep is a lyrical vision of friendship, hidden secrets, and desires. Cohen uses several types of film image to add texture to the layered composition. Beautiful shades of grey, silver, black and blue echo the water, reminiscent of early photography and silverprints. Cohen says, “The piece was constructed primarily from footage I’d shot of skinnydippers at swimming holes in Georgia and rural Pennsylvania. It’s about water and memory and stories just submerged. It is also, in part, a response to thinking about censorship. I would say that Drink Deep is both unabashedly and deceptively romantic. Surface, flow, and undertow. What looks like paradise is always paradise lost.” Music composed by Stephen Vitiello and performed with Gabriel Cohen and Mary Wooten.

results.title: Suggested photo spots
results.brief_description: Strap on your seat belts and get comfortable for a 7,000 mile drive. This documentary invites you to travel along with the Center for Land Use Interpretation as they find Suggested Photo Spots across North America. Journey from coast to coast stopping long enough to take snap shots of unusual or exemplary land use sites across North America. You will even get to take a picture of Kodak’s own waste water treatment plant in Rochester, New York.
